title: Two found dead in Tambun resort landslide
Amaran buat syarikat amal diskriminasi terhadap wanita bertudung
article_content:
Kerajaan akan mengambil tindakan ke atas syarikat yang mengamalkan diskriminasi terhadap wanita bertudung memohon untuk mendapatkan pekerjaan.
Kementerian Pembangunan Wanita, Keluarga dan Masyarakat  memandang serius dan menyifatkan perkara itu tidak sewajarnya berlaku.
Datuk Rohani Abdul Karim juga menyeru agar wanita Islam tampil membuat aduan kepada kementerian sekiranya menjadi mangsa majikan yang menetapkan syarat tidak bertudung untuk mereka bekerja.
Klik video untuk berita penuh.

title: Warga emas terlepas tuduhan cabul cucu
article_content:
Mahkamah Majistret di sini Jumaat melepaskan dan membebaskan seorang lelaki warga emas daripada tuduhan mencabul kehormatan cucu perempuannya berusia 11 tahun.
Majistret Zulkpli Abdullah memutuskan bahawa pihak pendakwaan gagal membuktikan di luar keraguan munasabah tentang tuduhan yang dikenakan terhadap lelaki berusia 76 tahun itu.
"Setelah menimbang dengan teliti semua bukti yang dikemukakan dalam kes ini, mahkamah berpendapat, berdasarkan imbangan kemungkinan, terdapat keraguan munasabah bahawa tuduhan terhadap tertuduh lahir daripada konspirasi yang dibuat terhadapnya berikutan terdapat perebutan secara undang-undang berhubung penjagaan mangsa, iaitu cucu perempuan tertuduh, yang pada masa berkenaan, dikongsi penjagaannya oleh bapa dan emaknya," kata beliau.
Tertuduh, yang diwakili peguam Noor Azah Azizan, diperintah membela diri pada 14 Jun tahun lepas.
Dia dituduh melakukan kesalahan itu di empat tempat, termasuk di dua hotel dan di dalam sebuah kereta di sini dari pukul 1 tengah hari hingga 6 petang antara April 2010 dan Oktober 2011.
Timbalan pendakwa raya Nur Hafizah Rajuni berkata pihak pendakwaan akan memfailkan rayuan terhadap keputusan itu.

title: Muslim family members allowed to visit convicts on third, fourth day of Aidilfitri
article_content:
Family members of Muslim prisoners can meet them on the third and fourth days of the Aidilfitri celebration.
Prisons Department deputy director (Policy) Supri Hashim said this covers prisons and rehabilitation centres nationwide as well as the Henry Gurney School, with visiting time from 8.15am to 4.15pm.
"To simplify the visit arrangements, visitors are asked to respectively bring their visiting and identification cards. Outside food or drinks are not allowed to be given to the prisoners but only items that are bought from our canteens," he said in a statement here Wednesday.
Supri also advised all visitors to not give money to the prisoners as all their basic needs has been provided for by the Prisons Department and if they intend to do so such as for examination fees, it must be included with an official receipt as a declaration of acceptance.
Visitors are subject to regulations that allow the prison to run a physical examination on visitors before entering and leaving the premises.

title: Pura-pura tolong wanita, anak kecil sebelum merompak, lelaki dipenjara 9 tahun
article_content:
Seorang lelaki yang berpura-pura menolong seorang wanita bersama anak kecil yang keretanya tersadai di tepi jalan Mac lalu, hari ini dijatuhi hukuman penjara sembilan tahun dan satu sebatan kerana merompak barangan dan wang tunai milik wanita itu.
Hakim Mahkamah Sesyen, Hilmiah Yusof, menjatuhkan hukuman itu ke atas Johar Mohd Yusof, 44, seorang pengawal keselamatan, selepas dia menukar pengakuan kepada bersalah merompak Aryaty Ibrahim, 40.
Mahkamah memerintahkan hukuman penjara itu berjalan bermula dari tarikh dia ditangkap pada 22 April lalu.
Mengikut pertuduhan pindaan, Johar didakwa melakukan rompak berkumpulan ke atas wanita itu dengan merompak seutas jam tangan, sehelai baju kemeja, seutas rantai leher, satu cermin mata, seutas gelang tangan, sebuah telefon bimbit jenama Asus dan wang tunai RM400.
Kesalahan itu didakwa dilakukan di kawasan perniagaan Jalan PJS 3/32, di sini, pada pukul 1 petang, 31 Mac lalu mengikut Seksyen 395 Kanun Keseksaan yang membawa hukuman penjara maksimum 20 tahun dan sebatan. 
Terdahulu, Timbalan Pendakwa Raya Shafiq Hasim memohon hukuman berat memandangkan ketika kejadian mangsa bersama anak kecilnya sehingga menyebabkan kanak-kanak itu trauma.
"Selain itu, kerugian turut dialami mangsa kerana pelbagai barangan miliknya diambil. Saya juga mohon hukuman berbentuk sebatan juga dikenakan supaya dapat menginsafkan tertuduh," kata Shafiq.
Bagaimanapun, tertuduh yang tidak diwakili peguam merayu pertimbangan mahkamah agar menjatuhinya hukuman ringan dan hukuman penjara bermula dari tarikh dia ditangkap.
Mengikut fakta kes, pada hari kejadian, mangsa bersama anak lelakinya berusia lima tahun terpaksa memberhentikan keretanya di tepi jalan kerana suhu enjin kereta yang naik secara tiba-tiba.
Mangsa kemudian didatangi tertuduh yang menaiki kereta dan menawarkan diri untuk memandu kereta mangsa ke bengkel.
Namun, ketika dalam perjalanan ke bengkel, mangsa telah diarahkan keluar daripada kereta yang diberhentikan dan tertuduh kemudian bertindak mencekik serta merentap rantai di leher mangsa sebelum mengambil barangan lain milik mangsa. -- Bernama

title: Dr Mahathir terima semula jawatan Pengerusi BERSATU - Marzuki
article_content:
Perrdana Menteri interim, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad dilaporkan menerima kembali jawatan sebagai Pengerusi Parti Pribumi Bersatu (BERSATU), hari ini.
Perkara itu disahkan oleh Setiausaha Agung BERSATU, Datuk Marzuki Yahya.
Bagaimanapun memetik akhbar Harian Metro, perkembangan lanjut berhubung perkara itu akan dimaklumkan dalam tempoh terdekat.
Isnin lalu, Dr Mahathir mengumumkan melepaskan jawatan sebagai Pengerusi BERSATU, selain meletak jawatan sebagai Perdana Menteri.
Sebelum ini juga dilaporkan ahli BERSATU memberi sokongan penuh kepada Dr Mahathir untuk menarik kembali keputusan mengejutkan itu, sekali gus kembali menerajui parti komponen Pakatan Harapan (PH) itu.
Astro AWANI ketika ini sedang mendapatkan pengesahan lanjut daripada pihak BERSATU berhubung perkara ini.

title: Ismail Sabri akan ketuai UMNO jika pemilihan parti tahun ini - Nazri
article_content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sekiranya UMNO mengadakan pemilihan parti hujung tahun ini, Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob akan dicalon dan dipilih sebagai presiden parti, kata Ketua UMNO Bahagian Padang Rengas, Datuk Seri Mohamed Nazri Abdul Aziz.
Ahli Parlimen Padang Rengas itu menjelaskan perkara tersebut ketika ditanya pada satu forum di Yusof Ishak Institute di Singapura pada Khamis, sama ada Presiden UMNO Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi boleh dikalahkan sekiranya pemilihan parti itu diadakan dalam masa terdekat.
 Secara logiknya, jika kita ada pemilihan parti tahun ini. Dia (Ismail Sabri) sepatutnya menjadi presiden parti.
  
“Maksud saya presiden parti tidak semestinya menjadi perdana menteri dalam keadaan sekarang kerana kita perlu mendapat sokongan daripada gabungan kita.
 Contohnya seperti Zahid hari ini. Dia presiden. Kenapa dia bukan perdana menteri? Atas sebab yang jelas, dia ada kes di mahkamah,  katanya.
BACA: Najib dan Zahid langgar perjanjian - Nazri
Mengulas lanjut, Mohamed Nazri menjelaskan ahli-ahli UMNO akan menggunakan saluran undi sebagai tempat untuk meluahkan suara hati mereka.
Katanya, saluran undi yang rahsia itu akan digunakan sebaik-baiknya oleh ahli-ahli UMNO bagi menyatakan sokongan atau bantahan mereka kepada mana-mana pemimpin.
 Mereka (ahli UMNO) tidak suka bersuara. Apabila undi adalah rahsia, saya fikir mereka akan melakukan perkara yang betul.
 Mereka tidak perlu berkata apa-apa. Mereka hanya mengundi. Itu sahaja,  katanya lagi.
Ketika ditanya, apa akan berlaku sekiranya Ahmad Zahid terus dipilih mengetuai UMNO, Mohamed Nazri menjelaskan keadaan tidak akan berubah kerana Ahli Parlimen Bagan Datuk itu tidak boleh dilantik sebagai perdana menteri.
Mengulas tentang pindaan perlembagaan UMNO yang meluluskan usul agar pemilihan dibuat enam bulan selepas PRU diadakan, Mohamed Nazri menjelaskan apa yang difahaminya pemilihan parti tetap perlu dilakukan, bukan memanjangkan jangka hayat kepimpinan sekarang.

title: Spectators could soon attend live matches, announcement likely today - Reezal
article_content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Youth and Sports Minister Datuk Seri Reezal Merican Naina Merican has hinted that the government could soon give permission for supporters to watch sports events live at the stadium.
The announcement which has been highly anticipated by sports fans, and especially football supporters in the country, is expected to be made by Senior Minister (Security Cluster) Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob today.
Reezal Merican said the recommendations and standard operating procedures (SOP) presented by the ministry to the National Security Council (MKN) were generally well-received, although there were some parties that held reservations.
 God willing, the supporters will be given due consideration. It is possible that areas under the Recovery Movement Control Order will see a much higher number of spectators allowed.
“But the important thing is that I want to see an early start (pilot test) to boost football with the return of spectators to the stadium,  he said after observing the compliance of standard operating procedures (SOP) in the Malaysia Hockey League competition and the launch of the National Hockey Development Program (NHDP) logo at the National Hockey Stadium here last night.
-- BERNAMA

title: IWD2017: Help forge a more gender-inclusive world - Najib
article_content:
Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak Wednesday urged the people to help forge a more gender-inclusive world in their own respective spheres of influence.
He said as Malaysia marched towards 2020, it was still his ambition to see women being equal partners and drivers of growth.
"To do that, even more so for men, we must challenge gender bias and inequality, campaign against violence, shape women's advancement, celebrate women's achievements and champion women's rights for equal education," said Najib in his latest blog posting at najibrazak.com.
In realising the matter, everyone including men needed to be involved and to play their part, he said.
"I want all, especially men to #BeBoldForChange. Then and only then, men and women can be equal partners," Najib said.
The prime minister in his message also proudly noted that Malaysia had surpassed his vision to have 30 percent of women in decision-making positions in the public sector by 2016.
"I am proud that in Malaysia, women have made so many strides forward that by August 2015, we accomplished 37 percent of women in decision-making positions in the public sector.
"For when women succeed, we all triumph together. Happy International Women's Day to all!" said Najib.
International Women's Day, originally called International Working Women's Day, is celebrated on March 8 each year and the theme for this year is #BeBoldForChange. - BERNAMA

title: Bencana Fukushima: TEPCO diarah bayar pampasan lebih AS$560,000
article_content:
FUKUSHIMA: Mahkamah daerah Fukushima mengarahkan operator loji nuklear Fukushima, Tokyo Elektrik Company (TEPCO) membayar pampasan berjumlah A$566,000 kepada penduduk terkesan dengan bencana berganda pada 2011.
Sejumlah 525 plaintif terdiri daripada penduduk tempatan, memfailkan saman terhadap kerajaan Jepun dan TEPCO.
Mereka menuntut lebih AS$84,000 seorang sebagai pampasan kerosakan.
  
Selain bayaran pampasan yang perlu dibayar TEPCO, mahkamah sama juga mendapati kerajaan Jepun tidak mempunyai liabiliti bagi kemalangan berkenaan.
Sehubungan itu hakim menggugurkan kes saman terhadap kerajaan.
Bencana berganda Fukushima, yang berlaku pada 2011, menyebabkan sebahagian besar kawasan di daerah itu tidak lagi boleh diduduki susulan pencemaran radiologi.
Gempa yang berlaku pada Mac, menyebabkan loji nuklear fukushima terjejas hingga mencetus kebocoran bahan kimia.
Sebahagian besar penduduk terpaksa dipindahkan.

title: Isu Azam Baki: Lalitha dipanggil ke Bukit Aman
article_content:
SHAH ALAM: Polis telah memanggil bekas penyelidik di Pusat Memerangi Kronisme dan Korupsi (C4), Lalitha Kunaratnam ke Bukit Aman untuk disoal siasat mengenai dua artikelnya berkaitan pemilikan saham oleh Ketua Pesuruhjaya Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia (SPRM), Tan Sri Azam Baki.
Lalitha berkata, beliau dimaklumkan mengenai perkara itu melalui panggilan telefon oleh pihak polis pada pagi Isnin.
“Ya betul (dipanggil ke Bukit Aman). Khamis ini pada jam 2.30 petang,” katanya ketika dihubungi Sinar Harian pada Isnin.
  
Dua artikel laporan Lalitha bertajuk ‘Business ties among MACC leadership: How deep does it go?’ telah diterbitkan di sebuah portal berita pada 26 Oktober 2021.
Pada 12 Januari lalu, Azam telah memfailkan saman fitnah RM10 juta di Mahkamah Tinggi, Kuala Lumpur terhadap Lalitha berhubung artikel berkenaan.
Lalitha sebelum ini mendakwa Azam mempunyai konflik kepentingan dalam pemilikan saham mencecah nilai jutaan ringgit di beberapa syarikat.
Bagaimanapun, Azam dalam satu sidang akhbar khas memaklumkan saham itu merupakan milik adiknya yang dibeli menggunakan akaunnya pada 2015.
Artikel asal di Sinar Harian boleh dibaca di sini.

title: World Junior: Malaysia continue fine run in Spokane
article_content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia extended their excellent run at the 2023 World Junior Mixed Team Championships in Spokane, United States by securing a third win, this time over Latvia 5-0 on Tuesday.
In the tournament held at The Podium, mixed doubles pair Low Han Chen-Chan Wen Tse got the ball rolling for the national team as they took only 18 minutes to outplay Davis Strazdins-Nikola Mukiele 21-9, 21-3.
National boys' singles shuttler Muhammad Faiq Haziq had no problem securing a second point for Malaysia following a straight-set victory over Rihards Zugs 21-5, 21-8, while girls' singles player Ong Xin Yee lived up to expectations by taking the third point as she downed Anna Kupca 21-14, 21-5.
Boys' doubles pair Bryan Jeremy Goonting-Aaron Tai delivered the fourth point as they defeated Toms Sala-Davis Strazdins 21-5, 21-12 before national girls' doubles duo Chong Jie Yu-Carmen Ting wrapped the tie with a convincing 21-7, 21-7 win over Eiprila Briede-Darta Alise Demitere in the final match.
On Monday, Malaysia kicked off their Group C campaign in style as they overpowered Poland 4-1 in the opening match and demolished Austria 5-0 in the second tie.
Malaysia need to win against England in the last group match to be held later today to book a place in the tournament's quarter-final.
Only the team that finishes top of the group can qualify for the last eight.
Malaysia is currently at the top of the group with 3 points, followed by England (2 points) and Poland (1 point), while Austria and Latvia have yet to score a single point in the tournament.
In October last year, Malaysia failed to reach the quarter-finals of the World Junior Championships in Santander, Spain and finished the mixed team event in ninth place after defeating Denmark 4-1.
To make matters worse, it was also the first time no national player qualified for the quarter-finals of the singles competition in Spain.
This was the second time in a row that Malaysia returned empty-handed after the 2019 edition in Kazan, Russia.
The last time Malaysia won a medal in the tournament was in the 2018 edition in Canada when Goh Jin Wei emerged as the girls' singles champion while Pearly Tan-Toh Ee Wei took home silver in the girls' doubles event.
-- BERNAMA

title: Sarawak Cabinet sworn-in, no new faces
article_content:
Yang Dipertua Negeri Tan Sri Abdul Taib Mahmud and wife, Puan Sri Ragad Kurdi Taib today attended the swearing-in of the Sarawak state cabinet and assistant ministers, with no new faces in the line-up.
The ceremony held at Dewan Lapau in the State Legislative Assembly building, Petra Jaya was also attended by new Sarawak Chief Minister Datuk Amar Abang Johari Tun Openg and wife, Datin Amar Juma'ani Tuanku Bujang.
It began with the state cabinet members and assistant ministers receiving their letters of appointment from Taib.
Then they took their oath of office before Taib and witnessed by Abang Johari before signing the oath document.
Seven state full cabinet ministers took the oath led by Deputy Chief Minister Datuk Amar Douglas Uggah Embas, followed by the 18 assistant ministers.
Eight full ministers had been appointed to the state cabinet, but only seven took their oath of office today as Deputy Chief Minister Tan Sri Dr James Jemut Masing was not present at the ceremony.
The appointments saw all the state's full ministers and assistant ministers retained as before.
-- BERNAMA

title: Tingkatan Enam: Kuasa autonomi, pendedahan dan latihan secukupnya kepada pengetua
article_content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sesi kemasukan lepasan Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) ke Tingkatan Enam pada 17 Julai lepas merupakan pengambilan terakhir kendalian Kementerian Pendidikan (KPM) apabila kuasa tersebut diserahkan kepada pengetua sekolah atau pengetua Kolej Tingkatan Enam berkuat kuasa serta-merta.
Ini bermakna, kuasa autonomi yang diberikan kepada pengetua dan pengurusan sekolah membolehkan mereka menguruskan pemilihan pelajar ke Tingkatan Enam sebelum menyambung pengajian ke peringkat lebih tinggi.
Biarpun begitu, ketika ramai yang menyambut baik usaha KPM menjenamakan semula Tingkatan Enam kepada Kolej Pra-Universiti dalam menaik taraf sistem pendidikan, ada pakar pendidikan berpandangan pengetua yang terlibat perlu diberikan pendedahan yang optimum tentang amalan terbaik proses pengambilan pelajar.
  
Ini bagi memastikan proses tersebut bukan sahaja lancar dan teliti tetapi juga seimbang, saksama serta inklusif. Menerusi pengalaman dan sokongan yang diberikan pelbagai pihak yang berkaitan, pengetua dapat mengenal pasti pelajar yang benar-benar berpotensi sebelum membuat tawaran tersebut.
Mengulas tentang hal itu, Timbalan Naib Canselor Akademik dan Antarabangsa, Universiti Putra Malaysia (UPM) Prof Dr Ismi Arif Ismail berkata sebelum pengambilan pelajar baharu Tingkatan Enam pada tahun depan, pengetua perlu diberi pendedahan dan latihan mencukupi tentang tanggungjawab baharu mereka.
 Selaras dengan usaha penjenamaan pengurusan semua Tingkatan Enam kepada Kolej Pra-Universiti, memang sudah sampai masanya kuasa dan pemilihan pelajar diberikan kepada pengetua. Ini sebagai persediaan bagi mereka untuk mengambil tanggungjawab mempromosi dan memilih pelajar yang berpotensi untuk mengikuti program prauniversiti sebelum melangkah ke alam universiti.
 Walaupun begitu, saya berpandangan garis panduan sahaja tidak mencukupi kerana pengetua perlu didedahkan kepada proses pengambilan pelajar kerana sebelum ini ia dikendalikan sepenuhnya KPM dan kerana itu mereka perlu diberi latihan,  katanya kepada Bernama.
KETIRISAN MAKLUMAT
Beliau berpandangan latihan yang mencukupi kepada pengetua boleh dilakukan dengan menjalinkan kerjasama bersama rakan pengurusan daripada program matrikulasi di KPM dan juga Asasi di institusi pengajian tinggi (IPT) dalam melengkapkan mereka dengan sistem pengambilan sepertimana di universiti sebelum melaksanakan kuasa autonomi tersebut.
Menteri Pendidikan Fadhlina Sidek sebelum ini mengumumkan kementerian memberi kuasa autonomi kepada pengetua Pusat Tingkatan Enam untuk menjalankan proses pengambilan pelajar, berkuat kuasa serta-merta.
Langkah itu katanya bagi membolehkan pengetua membuat tawaran terus kepada pelajar berpotensi yang memerlukan peluang menyambung pengajian tanpa perlu menunggu tawaran daripada KPM sepertimana tahun-tahun sebelum ini.
Bagi tujuan itu, KPM kini dalam proses menyiapkan garis panduan pengambilan pelajar kepada Pengetua Pusat Tingkatan Enam yang diberikan kuasa autonomi tersebut dan dijangka akan dapat disiapkan pada awal Ogos ini.
Selain itu, pakar juga melihat pelaksanaan kuasa autonomi ini dapat menangani ketirisan maklumat apabila pelajar mendapat maklumat tepat berkaitan kemasukan ke Tingkatan Enam dan juga subjek yang ditawarkan bersesuaian dengan minat, kelayakan dan halu tuju
Menjelaskan mengenainya, Timbalan Dekan Penyelidikan, Inovasi dan Libatsama Komuniti-Industri, Pusat Pengajian Ilmu Pendidikan, Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM) Prof Madya Dr Aziah Ismail berkata sebelum ini pelajar lepasan SPM sukar untuk mendapatkan maklumat jelas mengenai subjek yang bersesuaian diambil di Tingkatan Enam untuk digunakan bagi melanjutkan pelajaran ke peringkat lebih tinggi dalam bidang yang diminati.
 Dengan mandat yang diberikan kepada pengetua dan pasukan mereka di sekolah ataupun Kolej Pra-Universiti, ini dapat menyahpusatkan proses pengambilan yang sebelum ini diuruskan KPM.
 Apabila pengetua mengambil alih, ini memudahkan pelajar mendapat maklumat mengenai pembelajaran di Tingkatan Enam dan dengan cara ini ketirisan maklumat dapat dikurangkan,  katanya.
Aziah yang turut terlibat bersama pasukannya dalam memberikan cadangan penubuhan Kolej Tingkatan Enam berkata syarat kemasukan ke Tingkatan Enam juga perlu menepati satu kriteria standard bagi memastikan kualiti pendidikan Tingkatan Enam dapat dipertingkatkan sesuai dengan usaha penjenamaan tersebut.
Hanya pelajar lepasan SPM yang benar-benar layak sahaja ditawarkan menyambung pengajian di Tingkatan Enam, sementara mereka yang tidak layak dijuruskan ke pusat pengajian lain termasuk latihan vokasional, katanya.
Ketika diminta mengulas kebimbangan ibu bapa sekiranya kuasa autonomi itu disalahgunakan, Aziah menegaskan isu ketelusan pengetua dalam pengambilan pelajar ke Tingkatan Enam dapat diatasi dengan garis panduan yang akan disediakan KPM nanti.
 Cadangan yang diberikan selaras Pembangunan Pendidikan Malaysia (PPPM) 2013 - 2025 bertujuan untuk memberikan pengalaman pra-U (prauniversiti) kepada pelajar yang berada di Tingkatan Enam untuk mendapat pengalaman sama dengan pelajar pra-U yang lain seperti pelajar asasi dan matrikulasi,  katanya.
Usaha penjenamaan Tingkatan Enam sudah bermula lebih 10 tahun lalu apabila pada 2012 pentaksiran baharu STPM telah diluluskan dengan tempoh pengajian di Tingkatan Enam selama tiga semester atau satu tahun setengah.
Seterusnya pada 2014, KPM membenarkan pelajar Tingkatan Enam memakai pakaian kasual dengan beberapa syarat ditetapkan, dan pada 12 Julai tahun ini, Kolej Tingkatan Enam kini dikenali sebagai Kolej Pra-Universiti KPM dengan jawatan pengetua akan ditukarkan kepada pengarah.
Penjenamaan semula itu turut menyaksikan perubahan nama jawatan, iaitu guru penolong kanan kepada timbalan pengarah, manakala guru kepada pensyarah dan murid menjadi pelajar.
Ini juga sebagai usaha menarik minat lepasan SPM untuk menyambung pengajian di Tingkatan Enam selain mendedahkan pelajar kepada suasana pembelajaran di IPT.
ATASI KECICIRAN
Dalam pada itu, pemberian kuasa autonomi ini juga dilihat dapat membantu menangani masalah keciciran pelajar melanjutkan pelajaran ke peringkat lebih tinggi, terutama golongan miskin dan kurang berkemampuan.
Menurut Presiden Majlis Permuafakatan Persatuan Ibu Bapa dan Guru Nasional (PIBGN) Prof Madya Datuk Dr Mohamad Ali Hasan, tidak semua pelajar lepasan SPM berjaya menempatkan diri mereka di IPT awam selepas SPM meskipun ada yang memperoleh keputusan yang baik dalam peperiksaan itu.
 Inisiatif KPM ini dapat memotivasikan serta menggalakkan pelajar yang layak menyambung pelajaran dan ini secara tidak langsung juga dapat membendung keciciran pelajar,  katanya yang turut menambah pengetua juga harus memastikan pengambilan pelajar seimbang daripada pelbagai latar belakang.
Beliau juga mengharapkan dengan adanya kuasa autonomi tersebut, pengetua akan mencari inisiatif atau solusi dalam mengesan pelajar keluarga miskin yang layak untuk memasuki Tingkatan Enam tetapi terhimpit dengan kekangan kewangan.
Bersetuju dengan pandangan tersebut, Ismi Arif berkata langkah itu boleh dilakukan oleh pengetua Kolej Tingkatan Enam dengan mengenal pasti pelajar yang berminat memasuki ke Tingkatan Enam menerusi kerjasama dengan sekolah-sekolah lain.
 Ada kurang berkemampuan, ada juga pelajar memang berminat ke Tingkatan Enam. Jadi, dengan kuasa autonomi yang ada pada pengetua, mereka boleh mengenal pasti pelajar-pelajar yang berminat ke Tingkatan Enam atau tidak berkemampuan melanjutkan pengajian ke peringkat lebih tinggi dengan lebih awal.
 Langkah ini boleh dilakukan dengan kerjasama yang terjalin antara pengetua Kolej Tingkatan Enam dengan pengetua sekolah menengah lain dalam mengenal pasti pelajar yang boleh dilakukan sebelum peperiksaan SPM atau selepas mendapat keputusan,  katanya. - BERNAMA / Nurqalby Mohd Reda

title: Politik Melayu perlu bersatu - SEDAR
article_content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sebuah kerajaan pemerintahan dominan pribumi (PDP) yang kuat diyakini akan terbentuk jika tiga parti Melayu iaitu UMNO, Pas dan Bersatu menghadapi Pilihan Raya Umum ke-15 (PRU15) kelak sebagai satu pasukan.
Timbalan Presiden Jaringan NGO Sedar (SEDAR), Datuk Seri Wan Ahmad Wan Omar, berkata, amat mengecewakan jika tiga parti politik ini gagal mencari kesepakatan sebagai satu pasukan yang mantap untuk menyekat Pakatan Harapan dan DAP kembali berkuasa.
 Orang Melayu rata-rata serik dengan pengalaman 22 bulan di bawah Pakatan Harapan yang ditunjangi DAP dan PKR yang liberal.
  
 Tun Mahathir telah diperalatkan untuk menarik undi Melayu. Apa yang berlaku selama 22 bulan benar-benar telah membuka mata orang Melayu,  katanya dalam satu kenyataan pada Ahad.
Justeru, jaringan NGO SEDAR menyeru dan merayu kepada kepimpinan UMNO, Pas dan Bersatu supaya segera mencari penyelesaian agar satu jajaran politik yang kuat diwujudkan.
 Itulah satu-satunya jalan bagi menzahirkan sebuah PDP yang kuat dan stabil selepas PRU15.
 Hanya kerajaan PDP yang kuat mampu menjamin butir-butir Kontrak Sosial yang termaktub dalam Perlembagaan Persekutuan dihormati,  katanya lagi.

title: Tidak kira kaum, hina ATM tindakan jijik, tak boleh diterima - Mat Sabu
article_content:
Tindakan pihak yang menghina Angkatan Tentera Malaysia (ATM) disifatkan perbuatan jijik dan tidak boleh diterima sama sekali.
Demikian tegas Menteri Pertahanan Mohamad Sabu yang mengatakan, pasukan pertahanan itu seharusnya dipandang tinggi atas pengorbanan selama ini dalam memastikan keamanan negara.
"Apabila seorang jutawan mengatakan tentera makan, tidur, elok jadi peneroka Felda. Rakyat melenting. Pelbagai pihak membela angkatan tentera. Saya melihat isu perkauman dimainkan.
“Apabila seorang Melayu Islam mengkritik angkatan tentera, netizen diam, tetapi apabila ada orang Tionghua (berkata yang sama), rakyat melenting.
"Kita tidak kira apa-apa kaum. Menghina angkatan tentera ialah satu perkara jijik dan tidak boleh kita terima," katanya dalam ucapan pada Majlis Pelancaran Sambutan Hari Kebangsaan Kementerian Pertahanan di ibu negara pagi ini.
BACA: Fahami peranan, pengorbanan Angkatan Tentera Malaysia 
Terdahulu, beliau hadir pada perhimpunan dan pelancaran Kempen Kibar Jalur Gemilang sempena sambutan Bulan Kebangsaan 2019 di Dataran Wisma Pertahanan, Kementerian Pertahanan, Jalan Padang Tembak di sini.
 
	
BACA: Polis akan panggil Dong Zong, Koon Yew Yin, Zakir Naik - Muhyiddin
Mohamad berkata, tentera juga menjadi tulang belakang kepada operasi menyelamat apabila Malaysia mahupun negara jiran menghadapi krisis atau bencana. 
Mereka juga berada di serata dunia, katanya, berkhidmat di bawah panji Pertubuhan Bangsa-Bangsa Bersatu (PBB) untuk misi keamanan sejagat.
	
		“
	Saya mengambil serius sebarang tindakan menghina anggota tentera tanpa mengira kaum.
	
		”
	
		- Mohamad Sabu
BACA: Apa benar tentera kita hanya makan dan tidur? 
Begitu juga, tambahnya, aset-aset ketenteraan bukan sahaja digunakan untuk pertahanan, tetapi juga untuk pelbagai operasi semasa aman.
"Yang jelas dan pasti, ATM adalah barisan hadapan kerajaan bagi menangani pelbagai isu keselamatan di peringkat domestik dan antarabangsa.
"Apabila negara aman, rakyat dapat melakukan aktiviti harian dengan selamat tanpa perlu risau ditembak atau dibom seperti sesetengah negara lain.
"Pelabur luar dan pelancong juga akan datang ke Malaysia apabila mengetahui negara ini dalam keadaan aman."
BACA: Perkasa gesa dua tokoh disiasat Akta Hasutan
	
		
			JANGAN HINA TENTERA!
			
			Saya mengambil serius sebarang tindakan menghina anggota tentera tanpa mengira kaum.
			
			Ucapan penuh saya di;https://t.co/i6MXuMm6vh pic.twitter.com/aybJ1Gs0Ig
		— Mohamad Sabu (@MSabu_Official) August 16, 2019
Pada Khamis, 50 ahli daripada tiga cawangan Persatuan Veteran Angkatan Tentera Malaysia (PVATM) membuat laporan polis di Pahang terhadap ahli perniagaan Koon Yew Yin, yang dikatakan telah menghina maruah pasukan tentera di laman sosial.
Ketua PVATM Cawangan Paya Besar Abdullah Seman mendesak supaya tindakan tegas diambil terhadap Koon, bagi memelihara martabat tentera yang menggadai nyawa mereka untuk keselamatan negara.
Pada Selasa, media melaporkan Koon telah memuat naik kenyatan mendakwa anggota tentera sepatutnya menggantikan pekerja asing di ladang, kerana seperti diketahuinya anggota itu hanya makan dan tidur, dengan majoriti tidak pernah melepaskan tembakan melainkan ke arah papan sasaran.

title: Keeping pace with digital transformation: Cultivating the seeds for the future tech talent
article_content:
One thing that I have learned by working in a world-leading tech company is that with the advancements in technology, especially in recent times, simply being tech-literate today isn’t enough.
Which is why academic curriculums all over the world are incorporating skills like robotics and coding for children as young as the age of five. To outpace or at least to keep pace with technological evolution today, we have to bring ourselves beyond tech literacy to being tech-savvy.
The pandemic-driven New Normal has pushed organisations past the tipping point. This was made clear in a global survey of executives conducted by management consulting firm McKinsey & Company, which spoke about how the ongoing health and economic crisis has expedited the adoption of digital technologies among businesses by several years.
On top of that, the C-suites surveyed claimed that funding or investments sowed into digital initiatives have increased more than anything else.
Still, in the same survey, a glaring common denominator: Apart from using more advanced technologies and speeding up experimenting and innovation -- was the notion that there is a critical need to fill the widening gaps for digital talent amid the pandemic.
Beyond literacy: Job security is found in being digitally savvy in a digital world
The New Normal has pushed forward the need for enhanced productivity, speed, innovation, convenience, and efficiency – demanding a smarter, more intelligent present and future, which is made possible with the advent of advanced technologies and solutions such as automation, Cloud computing, 5G, and Machine Learning.
With this acceleration comes the urgency for skillsets to see these technologies applied. The World Economic Forum’s (WEF) Future of Jobs 2020 report published in October last year listed Cloud computing, Big Data, and e-commerce as the top technologies most likely to be adopted by companies.
The report also highlighted a significant rise in interest in encryption among employers, reflecting the new vulnerabilities of our Digital Age, and a notable increase in the number of firms expecting to adopt non-humanoid robots and Machine Intelligence, with both technologies slowly becoming a mainstay across industries.
Yet, according to McKinsey, a majority of businesses surveyed noted having encountered cultural and talent gaps, as well as weak partnerships between IT and the rest of their business divisions. Hence, overcoming these hurdles would require organisations to reskill people, reset company culture, foster closer IT–business relationships, and on top of all these, meticulously measure the value of IT.
Ready or not, the workforce must be equipped
A World Economic Forum report tells us that professions which are considered newer skilled and emerging are expected to increase from about eight percent to more than 13 percent over the next four years.
Based on this data, WEF projected that close to 85 million jobs could be displaced for roles that divide human work from machine work, although a new set of 97 million job opportunities that require skills around machine interaction and algorithmic expertise could be created.
Still, in the same report, skills gaps in the local labour market as well as the inability to attract the right talent were highlighted as among the major barriers to the adoption of new technologies
In fact, as part of its Global Survey, McKinsey pointed out that between 71 and 90 percent of their respondents say that their skill transformations have demonstrated positive outcomes in the ability to realise company strategy; employee performance and satisfaction; and employers’ reputation.
Huawei organises for the future with tech and capable talent
As a global technological leader and agent of change, Huawei has made a strong commitment towards helping industries and governments achieve their mission and vision of developing their own workforce of tomorrow, driven and enabled by the ubiquity of technology and the ever-evolving Digital Economy.
With talent development a key priority for our company whether internally or for our clients and stakeholders, Huawei has rolled out several initiatives which are geared for training and nurturing digital skills. In essence, these are programmes that serve a common purpose -- which is to encourage more Malaysians to pursue and build ICT skills in order to be a part of a digitally skilled talent pool for the future.
One example is the Seeds for the Future programme. Initiated in 2008, Seeds for the Future is Huawei’s flagship global Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiative, designed to inspire local talents and encourage the sowing of digital ‘seeds’ in society – especially among the younger generation – to future-proof the society of tomorrow.
The programme has benefited more than 5,000 students across the Asia Pacific region, but we are not stopping there. In fact, we are ramping up our efforts to encourage greater digitalisation across every sector of society and the economy.
At the APAC Media Virtual Roundtable which Huawei Asia Pacific hosted recently, we made it clear that our main focus remains in addressing digital inclusion and sustainable development of this region. Jay Chen, the Vice President of Huawei Asia Pacific, announced Huawei’s plan to cultivate more than 40,000 ICT talents over the next five years through multiple programmes, including Seeds for the Future.
In realising the benefits of Seeds for the Future and how it has impacted the lives of participants in so many positive ways, Huawei in early-July this year announced its Seeds for the Future Program 2.0.
One of our biggest missions through this second instalment is our plan to invest US$150 million in digital talent development over the next five years, which is expected to benefit an additional three million across the globe.
Closer to home, Huawei’s long-term collaboration with Malaysia’s Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE) dates back to 2014, when both parties joined hands to conduct the Seeds for the Future programme. To date, we have assisted over 96 students from various universities in levelling up their digital skills.
We believe that the youth are the key to our future. They may be ‘seeds’ now but we believe that by equipping them with the right digital skills, they will be key contributors to the nation in the shape of ‘trees’ in the future.
We are also actively partnering universities across Malaysia to provide relevant training covering 5G, Cloud computing, Big Data, and other emerging and disruptive technologies through our Huawei ICT Academy.
We have collaborated with more than 30 universities across the country for the Huawei ICT Academy programme – which has been incorporated as part of the Huawei ASEAN Academy, to integrate regional resources, enable Malaysian digital talent, promote Malaysia’s Digital Economy and assist Malaysia in its digital transformation journey and ultimately, carry out its role and duties as the ASEAN Digital Hub.
To this end, we are proud and honoured to have trained and developed over 8,800 Malaysian talents through our Huawei ASEAN Academy. Our target for the next five years, however, is to have 50,000 ICT talents successfully graduate from our Academy.
That is not all. We also recently inked a Digital Leadership Memorandum of Understanding (MoU with Celcom Axiata Berhad (Celcom) to launch a set of talent development programmes aimed at building ICT talents to future-proof a digital future for Malaysia.
The Digital Leadership programme aims to nurture aspiring ICT professionals, equipping them with skills related to latest technological developments such as Big Data, Cloud computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), 5G technology and pervasive technologies that will further empower Celcom to be at the forefront of technology innovation.
Jump on the bandwagon or risk losing out
It is imperative that we understand that digital transformation is more than just about technology – it is about having both machines and humans co-existing to realise the possibilities for efficiency gains and better customer experience.
Having the financial capacity to invest in, purchase and utilise new technologies is a good start but one’s ability to adapt to an increasingly digitised world depends on the next generation of skills, bridging the gap between talent supply and demand, and future-proofing yours as well as your employees’ potential.
This is why it is important to have public-private collaborations to drive and encourage digital adoption, and to ensure present and future workforces are equipped with skills needed by the industries of today and tomorrow.
To jointly lead economies and societies towards greater prosperity, the public and private sector will need to identify and address the hurdles or factors behind the misallocation and waste of human capabilities and potential.
Hence, here are some thoughts on how organisations can better prepare and future proof themselves for the new digital world:
• Putting people first: While technology is about doing or achieving more with less, we still need human hands and minds to maximise the full potential of new or emerging technologies. If we can leverage human adaptability to reskill and upskill our workforce, then we can simultaneously elevate both humans and technology. Therefore, as business leaders think about investing in technology, they should first think about investing in the people who can maximise those tools and solutions.
• Nurture soft skills: Just as humans and hard skills are important pieces of the digital transformation puzzle, soft skills such as communication, teamwork, collaboration, leadership, critical thinking, and problem solving are must-haves in the Digital Era. That being said, to keep your organisation at the forefront, it is crucial to establish the right balance of technically minded employees and those with more traditional skillsets.
• Top-down approach: As the saying goes – the only thing that is constant is change. However, change is much more likely to happen if we drive it from the top down. In the context of digital transformation, the main implication is that we cannot expect big changes or upgrades to an organisation unless we start by selecting and developing our own top leaders in that vein to begin with.
For us at Huawei, our digital transformation journey began in 2016. We were faced with the urgency to make our supply chain more efficient and streamline various end-to-end processes. In addition to that, we also had to create digital employees to generate greater business value -- a step we took in 2020.
To do this, we defined business roles, built and improved operations as well as cognitive models along business processes and used new technologies to boost business efficiency and agility.
Tech + Talent: The recipe for success in a post-pandemic Digital World
While the pandemic has basically turned the world upside down, it has also provided many businesses the opportunity to explore new horizons in terms of methods of working, and spotlighted new areas in talent investments, resulting in enhanced opportunities and social prosperity.
Certainly, many can relate to the view that addressing these issues and gaps in our current workforce involves creating stronger and fruitful partnerships between various stakeholders to provide the necessary tools to prepare people and companies for the ever-shifting needs of the new digitally-powered economy.
Talent strategies must be immediately structured towards succeeding with digital to avoid being left behind.
Mastering new skills, upskilling and reskilling must be the new mantra for companies’ strategies towards their workforces.
In short, apart from utilising readily available technologies that we have at our disposal today, having and developing talent with digital skills is extremely important in order for us to tap on the power of technology to enhance efficiencies, optimise productivity, and on the overall, ultimately improve lives.
	*Rita Irina Abd Wahab is Vice President Of Public Affairs and Communications, Huawei Malaysia

title: 19 resort staff stranded at Gunung Jerai peak
article_content:
YAN: Nineteen employees of the Jerai Hill Resort are currently stranded on top of Gunung Jerai after the path leading down to the foothills of the mountain became inaccessible, following a landslide that occurred this afternoon.
An employee, who preferred to be known as Hisyam, 32, said all those involved would be spending the night on top of the mountain tonight.
He said heavy rain and storms since 2 pm, and a landslide that occurred at 4 pm, have made it impossible to access the area.
 Power supply to the hotel was also cut off and we are now relying on the generator for electricity,  he said when contacted by Bernama.
He also said that the situation on top of the mountain was under control and the rain has stopped; police and Fire and Rescue Department personnel are also present to monitor the situation.
-- BERNAMA

title: 'Paying Muhyiddin a visit after he was dropped is not wrong' - Mukhriz Mahathir
article_content:
Kedah Menteri Besar, Datuk Seri Mukhriz Mahathir does not feel it was wrong to visit Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin, after the latter was removed from the Deputy Prime Minister’s post.
However he said, he is ready to face any political consequences from the move.
He said, he paid Muhyiddin a visit on the capacity of Kedah Menteri Besar, to thank the former Education Minister for assistance rendered to Kedah.
Mukhriz explained, the visit is nothing out of the ordinary. He said no issues had been raised he visited the family of the late PAS Mursyidul Am, Datuk Nik Abdul Aziz Nik Mat, following his death.
“I don’t see what I did was wrong. It is better if you asked someone else that question. Should action be taken against me for visiting a former leader to extend by gratitude? I feel it’s not wrong,” he said when met after an the Jerlun UMNO division open house in Alor Setar today.
“However I’m ready to face any consequences for my actions,” he said.
Mukhriz was asked to comment on rumours that his position as Menteri Besar was said to be at stake after Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak reshuffled the Cabinet on Tuesday.
On the audio recording between Muhyiddin, Mukhriz and Tan Sri Abdul Kadir Sheikh Fadzir regarding allegations that RM2.6 billion was transferred into the Prime Minister’s account, Mukhriz did not deny the conversation took place.
Mukhriz explained he could not stop Muhyiddin in discussing whatever he wanted in his own home.
Abdul Kadir had also confirmed the conversation took place but did not provide further details. He stressed it was a private conversation and should not have been recorded.
Muhyiddin has yet to comment on the audio recording.
Meanwhile, UMNO Supreme Council member, Datuk Tajuddin Abdul Rahman was confident the Prime Minister will answer to all the issues raised following the audio recording and urged all parties to be patient.
“I’m confident Najib will not ignore the matter. He will provide an explanation, just be patient,” he was quoted by Malaysiakini as saying.

title: Diplomats in Sri Lanka urge govt action against anti-Muslim attacks
article_content:
Diplomats on Thursday condemned violence against Muslims in Sri Lanka and urged the government to uphold minority rights and freedom of religion.
More than 20 attacks on Muslims have been recorded since April 17, including including arson at Muslim-owned businesses and petrol-bomb attacks on mosques.
Muslims have blamed the attacks on Body Bala Sena (BBS) or the "Buddhist Power Force", an organisation that says the spread of Islam is a threat to Buddhism as the dominant religion. It denies any involvement.
"It is important that the rule of law be applied against those perpetrators and it's important that minority rights and freedom of religion are upheld," one of the diplomats, Canadian high commissioner Shelley Whiting, told reporters.
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe have ordered police to uphold the law, but the violence against Muslims has not ended.
Muslims comprise around 9 percent of Sri Lanka's population of 21 million. Buddhists make up about 70 percent of the population.
Buddhist groups accuse some Muslim organisations of radicalising the community and forcibly converting people to Islam. Muslim leaders have denied the claim.
Tung-Lai Margue, ambassador of the European Union, said he hoped the police would make arrests in the coming days.
Australian High Commissioner Bryce Hutchesson said acts of hate had been directed "unacceptably at the Muslim community".
"To my knowledge, this kind of collective public diplomatic intervention is unprecedented in Sri Lanka," Alan Keenan, Sri Lanka project director at the International Crisis Group, said on Twitter.
In 2014, three Muslims were killed in riots stirred up by hardline Buddhist groups. President Sirisena was elected the following year after a campaign in which he promised to solve the issues faced by ethnic minority Tamils and Muslims.
Churches also have faced similar attacks in the past.
The government ended a full-blown 26-year civil war by defeating Tamil Tiger rebels in 2009.

title: Remaja rugi RM18,000 diperdaya pembelian iPhone murah dalam talian
article_content:
KOTA BHARU: Gara-gara mahu membeli iPhone secara 'online', seorang pelajar lepasan Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) kerugian RM18,000 apabila ditipu semasa melakukan urusan tersebut dua minggu lalu.
Ketua Jabatan Siasatan Jenayah Komersial Kelantan, Superintendan Ahmad Azizul Mohamed berkata, remaja berusia 18 tahun itu dikatakan telah tertarik dengan iklan melalui laman sosial Instagram tersebut yang menyatakan penjual adalah 'Trusted Seller'.
 Menambah lagi keyakinan mangsa, wang akan dipulangkan jika telefon yang diterima pelanggan adalah tidak asli,  katanya dalam satu kenyataan, di sini, pada Ahad.
  
Menurutnya, susulan itu mangsa telah membeli dua unit iPhone 12 selepas menghubungi peniaga yang menggunakan nombor telefon negara jiran.
Beliau berkata, mangsa pada mulanya diminta untuk membuat bayaran RM400 (harga promosi RM200 seunit) ke akaun bank tempatan yang didakwa milik peniaga tersebut.
Ahmad Azizul berkata, bagaimanapun pada 14 Jun lalu, suspek telah menghubungi mangsa dan memintanya membuat bayaran berjumlah RM6,000 ke dua akaun bank tempatan milik individu berbeza bagi tujuan kad jaminan telefon tersebut.
Katanya, dalam tempoh seminggu berikutnya, mangsa telah membuat beberapa lagi transaksi bayaran berjumlah RM12,000 ke tiga akaun bank tempatan milik individu berbeza sebagaimana arahan peniaga itu.
 Pada 23 Jun, mangsa telah menerima pesanan mesej melalui aplikasi WhatsApp dari satu nombor yang tidak dikenali dan mendakwa sebagai kononnya pegawai penguat kuasa negara jiran.
 Pegawai penguat kuasa itu mendakwa mangsa telah membeli barangan yang tidak dibenarkan eksport oleh pihak berkuasa negara berkenaan.
 Mangsa diminta membuat bayaran pelepasan RM5,000 ke satu akaun bank tempatan yang lain sekiranya masih berminat untuk mendapatkan telefon berkenaan,  katanya.
Ahmad Azizul berkata, pada keesokan harinya (24 Jun), mangsa sekali lagi diminta membuat bayaran pelepasan, tetapi kali ini ke satu akaun bank di negara jiran.
Katanya, merasakan telah ditipu mangsa terus ke balai polis berhampiran untuk membuat laporan polis kerana masih belum menerima telefon yang dibelinya.
 Kes disiasat mengikut Seksyen 420 Kanun Keseksaan kerana menipu,  katanya.

title: Bertemu pembangkang: "Azmin bukan parti saya" - Tun M
article_content:
Perdana Menteri, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad masih enggan mengemukakan pandangan beliau berhubung pertemuan Menteri Hal Ehwal Ekonomi, Datuk Seri Mohamed Azmin Ali dengan pemimpin Barisan Nasional (BN) baru-baru ini.
Sebaliknya, Pengerusi Pakatan Harapan (PH) itu menyerahkan sepenuhnya kepada pucuk pimpinan Parti Keadilan Rakyat (PKR) untuk membuat keputusan.
“Saya tanya Azmin, apa yang dia bincang. Dia kata orang UMNO ini mereka sudah hilang parti, mereka tak tahu apa nak buat. Mereka tanya sama ada, nak masuk parti lain ataupun tidak.
“Ada (ahli Parlimen UMNO) yang membuat kenyataan, mereka sokong kepimpinan Dr Mahathir.
“Hak dia (Azmin) untuk jumpa sesiapapun. Kalau parti dia (PKR) tak setuju, parti dia bagi tau dia lah. Dia bukan parti saya,” katanya pada sidang media, di sini hari ini.
Beliau sebelum itu menyampaikan ucaptama pada Konvensyen Malaysia Future Leaders School (MFLS) di Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia (UKM).
Media difahamkan, Dr Mahathir mengadakan pertemuan dengan Mohamed Azmin semalam di Yayasan Kepimpinan Perdana, Putrajaya sebelum berlangsungnya pra-pelancaran Sidang Kemuncak Kuala Lumpur 2019.
